title: Lesson 56
paragraph: Narratives and inquiries explore knowledge and experience. Using models, legal frameworks, and responsive actions helps absorb and analyze information effectively.

words.meaning: a story or account of events
words.example: The teacher told a narrative about ancient civilizations.

words.meaning: a pursuit or search for something
words.example: The scientist embarked on a quest for a cure.

words.meaning: a representation or example to follow
words.example: The architect built a model of the building.
Some countries have legalized same-sex marriage.

words.meaning: able to be dictated or instructed
words.example: The terms are dictateable by the manager.

words.meaning: an area of study or activity
words.example: She is an expert in the medical field.

words.meaning: capable of taking in liquid or knowledge

words.example: He responded promptly to the email.

words.meaning: a group of customers or clients
words.example: The café has a loyal clientele.

words.meaning: an environment for buying and selling
words.example: The company expanded into a new market.
